term.title: isotopically unmodified

item.text: Describes a compound that has a macroscopic composition such that its constituentnuclides are present in the proportions occurring in nature.

sources.item: PAC, 1981, 53, 1887. 'Nomenclature of inorganic chemistry: II.1 - Isotopically modified compounds' on page 1889 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198153101887)

term.citation: Citation: 'isotopically unmodified' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.I03339

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
